title: Satellite repair and update
statement: The MOSAR technology shall allow repair and update of modular spacecraft by manipulation and repositioning of functional modules with a robotic manipulator

title: Mission tasks update
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be reconfigurable and should be able to use new functionalities brought by additional functional modules, in order to perform new mission tasks

title: Functional modules replacement
statement: The robotic manipulator shall be able to add and replace whole functional modules (ASM/APM) by using the interconnectors of these modules.

title: Robot relocation
statement: The robotic manipulator shall be able to reposition itself by using the interconnectors/structure of the functional modules or the spacecraft.

title: Design software
statement: A design software shall be able to create a robotic compatible servicing / reconfiguration plan for the modular spacecraft

title: Simulation software
statement: A simulation software shall be able to simulate the system with all related robotics elements following the execution plan

title: Robot high-level control
statement: The modular spacecraft shall perform the high-level control of the robot, by the execution and monitoring of the reconfiguration plan (task level)
comment: The high-level control of the robot can also be managed by the servicer satellite (depending on the servicing or local reconfiguration scenario)

title: Robot low-level control
statement: The robotic manipulator shall ensure its low-level control for the execution of the high- level tasks

title: Functional module monitoring
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be able to monitor the status of essential parameters of each connected functional module

title: Resources reallocation
statement: The system shall be able to reallocate resources (e.g. power, data, computational power, etc.) and assign different path automatically in case of a defect (e.g. interconnector of an APM)

title: Failure handling
statement: The system shall be able to handle the tasks even during a connection failure or a power interruption of defect modules/interconnectors.

title: Electrical power supply
statement: One or several modules options shall be available to implement for electrical power supply enabling operation of the functional modules and the robot manipulator
comment: The power system could be integrated by one or more functional modules

title: Electrical power supply, power management
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be able to shut down or command a stand-by mode of any non-critical module to reduce power consumption if needed. Critical functions should not be affected by shutting down of non-critical modules.

title: Data handling system
statement: One or several modules options shall be available to implement a data handling system (that can be composed of one or more modules) that enables operation of the different modules and the manipulator.
comment: The data handling system could be integrated by one or more functional modules

title: Heat management and thermal considerations
statement: One or several modules options shall be available to implement heat management functions that allow thermal regulation of the different modules within its specific range of temperatures. The heat management system could be composed of one or more modules.

title: Propulsion subsystem
statement: One or several modules options shall be available to implement a propulsion subsystem with capacity to perform at least: ??Station keeping manoeuvers. ??Orbit relocation. ??De-orbiting.
comment: The propulsion subsystem could be integrated by one or more functional modules.

title: Attitude control subsystem
statement: One or several modules options shall be available to implement an attitude control subsystem, with capacity to perform at least: ??Spacecraft reorientation. ??Attitude control compatible with mission objectives. ??Autonomous search of the Sun and the Earth
comment: The attitude control subsystem is essential to ensure correct functioning of other subsystems.

title: Module mechanical connections
statement: Modules shall be able to connect mechanically to other modules or to the spacecraft through interconnectors.
comment: Not every module is directly linked to the OBC of the modular platform. Data relay function is needed to dispatch telecommands and telemetries through a network of modules.

title: Module data relay
statement: Any module should be able to act as a data relay for other modules or the robotic manipulator through their interconnector, also if the module is in safe mode
comment: Not every module is directly linked to the OBC of the modular platform. Data relay function is needed to dispatch telecommands and telemetries through a network of modules. FM1 is in safe mode but still acts as data relay for FM2.

title: Data routing
statement: The OBC shall be able to redirect telecommands to specific modules, for the spacecraft configuration or for instance upon detection of failure on any point of the network. If an alternative path is not available, the OBC shall be able to isolate the faulty node and all the others nodes connected downstream.
comment:
FM5 has a nominal link to the OBC through FM3 and FM4. In case of failure of any of these components, the OBC should redirect telecommands to FM5 through the alternative path using FM1 and FM2.
FM7 only has connection to the OBC through FM6. In case of failure of FM1 the OBC should isolate both modules and stop sending TCs to them until FM6 is recovered. FM7 
cannot be a critical module.

title: Module power relay
statement: Module should be able to act as a power relay for other modules or the robotic manipulator through their interconnectors, also if the module is in safe mode
comment: To allow power distribution between the power supply (spacecraft or functional module) and the other active modules

title: Power routing
statement: The OBC shall be able to redirect power to specific modules, for the spacecraft configuration or for instance upon detection of power failure on any point of the network. If an alternative path is not available, the OBC shall be able to isolate the faulty node and all the others nodes connected downstream.
comment: To allow power distribution between the power supply (spacecraft or functional module) and the other active modules

title: Module thermal relay
statement: Module should be able to act as a thermal relay for other modules through their interconnectors
comment: To allow thermal distribution and management between the modules

title: Mechanical interfaces
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be able to withstand the loads expected on orbit with significant (TBD) safety margins. In any case, the mechanical integrity of the ensemble should not be compromised.

title: Manipulator mechanical loads
statement: The robot manipulator and its connections to the modules or spacecraft shall be able to withstand the loads expected during modules operations with significant (TBC) safety margins. In any case, the mechanical integrity of the robotic arm and its connection with the spacecraft or modules should not be compromised.

title: Mechanical interfaces (alignment and stiffness)
statement: The mechanical interfaces of the modular spacecraft shall provide the required alignment accuracy and stiffness required by the different modules to meet their respective performance requirements and to not constitute a harm to the rest of the spacecraft.
comment: The performance requirements of the different modules could be treated at system level, showing adequacy to the mission objectives. The minimum need in terms of alignment and stiffness of the mechanical interface should at least guarantee that every module is safely integrated into the modular platform.

title: Ground segment communication
statement: The modular spacecraft shall have a redundant communication link with the ground segment for telemetry and telecommands.

title: Telemetry of different modules
statement: Every module shall have a communication link enabling to send telemetry to the spacecraft monitoring unit (OBC) and ultimately to the ground station. The link with the ground station could be done through a specific communication module implemented on the modular spacecraft.

title: Ground segment surveillance
statement: The ground segment shall know at any moment the status of the different modules of the modular spacecraft. This information is passed through two types of telemetries: ??Periodic telemetry with standardized packets. ??Asynchronous telemetry with error message.
comment: The ground segment is able to detect problems in case an anomaly message is received (asynchronous telemetry). Even if the error message is never received (for instance, sudden power loss), the ground segment is able to detect a problem if the periodic telemetry is not received and investigate the problem by analyzing this data.

title: Grounding (electrical power)
statement: Any module of the modular spacecraft provided with an electrical power interface should have a connection to ground.
comment: Reduces the risk of introducing stray currents or ground loop currents.

title: Modular satellite reliability
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be quantifiably more reliable by design than a monolithic system over the mission lifetime of the satellite, including (and as a specific advantage) under extensions of mission lifetime.

title: Modular satellite flexibility
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be quantifiably more flexible in operation and responsive to mission changes than a traditional satellite with a similar mission.

title: Modular satellite economy
statement: The modular spacecraft shall have quantifiable advantages in cost-effectiveness and economy of operation from a mission perspective over the projected lifetime of the satellite. Otherwise, it should be demonstrated that the benefits (in terms of enhanced functionalities) compensate the additional costs.

title: Available connection interfaces
statement: The modular spacecraft and modules assembly shall implement a minimum number of connection interfaces such as at least two of these interfaces are available at any moment and within the reach of the robotic manipulator.
comment: one spot for anchorage on the client spacecraft and a second one for placing a new module.

title: Compatibility between modules
statement: The assembly of modules on a modular spacecraft respond to a planning and design that has previously being verified on ground.

title: Components weight
statement: The weight of all components associated with the concept of modular spacecraft shall be minimized (interconnectors, functional module structure, robotic manipulator)
comment: The concept of modular spacecraft brings additional components that creates a penalty on the system weight.

title: Interconnectors size and volume
statement: The size and volume of the interconnectors shall be minimized to offer more place inside the functional modules

title: Servicer satellite
statement: The functional modules shall be delivered to the modular spacecraft by a servicer satellite equipped with a robotic manipulator
covers: Mission analysis RD2 Operational Concept RD3

title: On-Orbit Rendez-vous, interfaces
statement: The modular spacecraft shall implement a physical interface for docking and/or berthing of a servicer satellite.

title: On-Orbit Rendez-vous, coupled spacecraft
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be able to remain coupled to the servicer spacecraft without time limitation.
comment: There should be no limitation coming from any of the subsystems of the modular spacecraft (ADCS, power, thermal etc.).

title: On-Orbit Rendez-vous, communication to servicer
statement: The modular spacecraft should be able to communicate with the servicer and exchange data during and after rendez-vous operation.
comment: Not essential during rendez-vous but highly desirable for enhanced autonomy during operations without (or with minimum) ground support.

title: On-Orbit Rendez-vous, ground communications
statement: The modular spacecraft shall be able to monitor operations during and after rendez- vous and send reports to the ground segment.
comment: Continuous link to ground stations is not essential for rendez-vous, however, different phases are usually defined with specific milestones that are controlled by ground operators. After rendez-vous, the communication supports transfer of the execution plan and the monitoring and feedback of the operations to the ground.

title: Space environment
statement: The components of the modular spacecraft: subsystems, interfaces and structures shall be able to withstand the space environment for the whole duration of the mission.
comment: Generic requirement to be verified depending on the specific application.

title: Launch loads
statement: The interconnectors design shall optimize launch load capabilities, to offer the wider range of possibilities regarding pre-assembled functional modules (on the initial spacecraft or the servicer) before launch
comment: Conditions are function of the launch conditions, configuration of the modules (inertia, COG,?? and type of connection with the launcher

title: Critical functionalities
statement: The failure of any functional module shall not yield to the loss of the spacecraft.

title: Redundancy of critical functionalities
statement: Any functional module providing a critical functionality (one that is needed for the safe mode of the functional platform) shall be redundant.

title: Propagation of failures
statement: Any module of the modular spacecraft shall be designed as to avoid failure propagation. In particular, the module shall prevent itself or any of its components from degrading performances of other modules or damaging the modular spacecraft.

title: Substitution of critical modules
statement: Any module that is considered critical (without this module the spacecraft loss one of its basic functionalities) can only be exchanged if: 1. Another module covering its functionality has already been added to the client spacecraft. 2. This second module is already operational. 3. The module to be substituted has already been isolated and switched off. 4. No anomaly has been detected between steps 2 and 3.
comment: The design principle of ?œdo not harm??should be applied for the modules of a modular spacecraft.

title: Robustness to power loss
statement: Any module shall be able to withstand a sudden power loss without any damage to itself or to other modules. The module shall autonomously shut down or enter a standby mode of minimum power consumption.
comment: The design principle of ?œdo not harm??should be applied for the modules of a modular spacecraft. In case of major anomaly of FM1, FM2 may suddenly lose its power supply.

title: Restart after power loss
statement: After a sudden power loss, any module of the modular spacecraft shall be able to restart and resume normal operation when power supply is restored.
comment: The design principle of ?œdo not harm??should be applied for the modules of a modular spacecraft. When functionality of FM1 is restored, the modules downstream (FM2) can restart and resume normal operation.

title: Data handling system (redundancy)
statement: The modular spacecraft shall implement a redundant on-board computer. The two (or more) OBCs could be integrated in different modules or in the same module. If the OBCs are integrated in the same module, two different interfaces should be provided, ensuring that in any case a single failure does not yield to the loss of the spacecraft.

title: Modular Satellite Failure Detection, Isolation and Recovery
statement: The modular satellite shall be able to detect failure of any module, isolate the faulty equipment and perform recovery operations when possible.

title: Safe mode
statement: The modular spacecraft shall implement a safe mode that guarantees a stable condition of the spacecraft without time limitation. This mode should be fully autonomous (without any ground intervention).

title: Safe mode (modules)
statement: Any module of the modular spacecraft shall implement a safe mode. This mode minimizes hardware and software functions as to make minimal use of the modular spacecraft resources (power).

title: Safe mode (command)
statement: The modular spacecraft should enter safe mode either by autonomous transition triggered by the on-board computer or through ground command.

title: Safe mode (modules, command)
statement: Any module of the modular spacecraft should enter in safe mode when commanded by the on-board computer of the modular spacecraft, by ground command or by autonomous triggering of the module itself.

title: Data relay for critical modules
statement: Any module considered as critical (needed for the safe mode of the modular platform, ensuring no loss of the spacecraft) shall have either: a) A direct connection to the OBC. b) Two independent paths to reach the OBC through other modules.
comment: FM1 and FM5 are critical modules. FM1 is directly connected to the OBC. FM5 is not directly connected to the OBC, but has two alternative ways of communicating with the OBC. The design is robust to a single failure of any of the non-critical modules.

title: Power relay for critical modules
statement: Any module considered as critical (needed for the safe mode of the modular platform, ensuring no loss of the spacecraft) shall have either: a) A direct connection to the power supply. b) Two independent paths to reach the power supply through other modules.

title: Single points of failure
statement: The design of the modular spacecraft shall minimize the number of single point of failures (failure that yields to loss of the spacecraft or its mission). Every single point of failure should be fully described, analyzed, and justified why any other implementation is not better than the selected one.

title: Configuration of the modular spacecraft
statement: A modular spacecraft implements identical modules in terms of structure shape and materials. Singularly, different shapes could be accepted provided that compatibility with the basic modules is ensured.
comment: The basic module is the rectangle. Singularly, other modules that are compatible could be added to the modular spacecraft.

title: Functional module orientation
statement: The functional module orientation shall be adjustable as function of its function and position on the modular spacecraft
comment: The function of the module could require a specific orientation (e.g. camera orientation, radiator)

title: Demonstrator purpose
statement: The MOSAR demonstrator shall illustrate the repair and update of modular spacecraft by manipulation and repositioning of SM with the WM.

title: Demonstrator components
statement: The MOSAR demonstrator shall include: ??A set of spacecraft modules (ASM/APM) to illustrate the scenarios and functionalities of modular spacecraft ??A robotic walking manipulator for the manipulation of the SM ??A servicer satellite and client modular spacecraft mockup to support the demonstration scenarios ??A monitoring and control center that includes a design and simulation tool to create and simulate the execution plan and a monitoring interface

title: Plan execution
statement: The SVC OBC shall execute autonomously the assembly/ reconfiguration plan prepared by the design and simulation tool
comment: None

title: SVC high level control
statement: The SVC OBC shall perform the high-level control of the WM, SM and SI for the execution of the assembly/ reconfiguration plan
comment: None

title: Components low level control
statement: Low level control of the WM, SM and SI shall be performed locally by each component
comment: This allow to relax constraints on the data bus requirements (e.g. high rate robotic control), the SVC OBC having to send only high level commands to the components

title: WM modules operations
statement: The WM shall be able to add and replace SM (ASM/APM) by using SI.
comment: None

title: WM relocation
statement: The WM shall be able to reposition itself by using the SI of the functional modules or the platform
comment: None

title: Monitoring
statement: The SVC OBC shall be able to monitor the parameters of the SM, WM and SI
comment: None

title: Spacecraft reconfiguration
statement: The system shall be able to re-configure the CLT (e.g. SM exchange) in case of a defect (e.g. malfunction of a SM)

title: System redundancy
statement: The system shall be able to re-route and reallocate resources (e.g. power, data, computational power, etc.) in case of a defect (e.g. interconnector of an APM)
comment: This should support connection failure or a power interruption of defect modules / interconnectors. Computational power can only be done in the simulator.

title: Modules Plug & Play detection
statement: The SVC OBC shall be able to detect and use additional functional modules (plug & play principle)

title: Fault detection
statement: The SVC OBC shall be able to react to a faulty behavior detected by the SM, WM or SI
comment: The reaction could include local management on the spacecraft (e.g. SM isolation) or feedback to the MCC

title: 3D reconstruction through WM
statement: A 3D reconstruction of the satellite could be produced from the observation by a camera mounted on the WM, with a maximum surface average error of 1cm
comment: Supported after re-configuration process. The WM is used to obtain different view points The 3D reconstruction should allow a human operator to assess the correctness of the re-configuration, and 1cm maximum surface error should be enough to meet the target

title: 3D reconstruction through SM
statement: A 3D reconstruction of the satellite could be produced from the observation by a camera mounted in a SM, with a maximum surface average error of 1cm
comment: Supported during re-configuration process, in real time (30 frames/sec) The 3D reconstruction should allow a human operator to assess the correctness of the re-configuration, and 1cm maximum surface error should be enough to meet the target.

title: Camera Localization
statement: The 3D pose estimation of the camera mounted on the WM could be computed based on the image stream, with a mean error not larger than 1 cm translation and 5Â° rotation, with a minimum of 30 frame/sec
comment: The accuracy of the estimated pose should allow correct positioning and connection of the hardware interfaces. It should also allow 3D reconstruction with errors defined in FuncR_A113 and FuncR_A114. 1cm translation and 5¡Æ rotation errors is a reasonable previously achieved target that are compatible with the initiation of the connection process of the interconnectors through the use of the form-fit guidance. Furthermore, localization has to happen in real time, and 30 milliseconds / frame is an acceptable value achieved by recent 3d localization and mapping algorithms as described in RD2.

title: SM Localization
statement: The 3D pose estimation of the SM could be computed based on the image stream obtained by the camera mounted on the WM, with a mean error not larger than 1 cm translation and 5Â° rotation, with a minimum of 30 frame/sec (first estimation of a new module 10 sec after appearance)
comment: The accuracy of the estimated pose should allow correct positioning and connection of the hardware interfaces. It should also allow 3D reconstruction with errors defined in FuncR_A113 and FuncR_A114. 1cm translation and 5Â° rotation errors is a reasonable previously achieved target that are compatible with the initiation of the connection process of the interconnectors through the use of the form-fit guidance. Furthermore, localization has to happen in real time, and 30 milliseconds / frame is an acceptable value achieved by recent 3d localization and mapping algorithms as described in RD2. Initial detection of a module does not require real-time capabilities, but needs to be achieved in useful operating time, 10 seconds is an acceptable operation delay.

title: Sub-systems TM/TC data rate
statement: TM/TC control of the WM and SM, including their SI, by the SVC OBC shall require a network supporting a data rate of 1Mbps or greater
comment: The TM/TC control of the platform should not rely on high data rate links with low latency.

title: Sub-systems services data rate
statement:
SVC OBC shall require a network supporting a data rate of 50Mbps or greater for SM
service data.
comment: For a camera APM, at 50 Mbps, a 4Mpixel image will take several seconds to transfer across the data network.

title: SVC to CLT mechanical interface
statement: The SVC shall provide a mechanical docking connection to the CLT
comment: The docking procedure is not part of the In MOSAR demonstration scenarios. Both spacecraft will be rigidly connected all along the demonstrations with a representative gap.

title: SVC to CLT data interface
statement: The SVC shall provide a data interface to the CLT to connect both internal networks
comment: The data interface allows the SVC to take the control of all the components for the execution of the re-configuration plan

title: SVC to CLT power interface
statement: The SVC shall provide a power interface to the CLT to be able to power CLT components
comment: Not required as, in the demonstration, the CLT could have his own power sub-system

title: MCC to SVC data link
statement: The MCC shall provide a data link for upload of the execution plan and TM/TC services with the SVC
comment: Represent the satellite link communication, could implement space standard communication protocols, e.g. the packet utilization standard (PUS) to give some level of representativeness to the demonstrator.

title: MCC to SVC debugging link
statement: The MCC shall provide a data link for monitoring and debugging purpose during the integration and testing of the demonstrator

title: SVC and CTL SI
statement: The SVC and CTL shall provide SI to enable connection with the SM and the WM

title: OG1 Reuse
statement: The platform shall implement ESROCOS from OG1 for the control of the system
comment: A number of adaptations and extensions are anticipate (see RD1)

title: OG2 Reuse
statement: The platform shall implement autonomy functions using OG2 (ERGO)
comment: A number of adaptations and extensions are anticipate (see RD1)

title: OG3 Reuse
statement: The platform shall implement sensor data fusion techniques from OG3 (Infuse)
comment: The WM operations would rely only on known geometry information, without the need of data fusion techniques. To be discussed and decided at SRR if data fusion techniques are illustrated in the scenario (e.g. SVC visual validation)

title: OG4 Reuse
statement: The satellite shall be equipped with its own integrated R-ICU derived from the OG4 I3DS architecture and illustrate operations of functional modules equipped with selected sensors suite from I3DS
comment: A number of adaptations and extensions are anticipate (see RD1)

title: OG5 Reuse
statement: The required H/W units in OG9 (platform, ASMs/APMs, robot) shall be equipped with standard interfaces from OG5.
comment: A number of adaptations and extensions are anticipate (see RD1)

title: SVC and CLT OBC
statement: The SVC and CLT spacecraft shall have on OBC for the management of the different components associated with the spacecraft and the communications
comment: In the MOSAR demonstration, the SVC OBC should take the lead on all the components of the system.

title: Data Network
statement: The system shall implement a data technology network that supports data bus re- configuration and routing
comment: In the MOSAR demonstration, the SVC OBC should take the lead on all the components of the system. The current selected technology is SpaceWire based on the developments and outputs of OG4

title: Relevance to flight hardware
statement: The demonstrator design should not be de-rated for demonstration use and be representative of an actual space system in terms of capabilities (e.g. mass movement capacity, speed of reconfiguration, processing capacity of on-board computing), while still retaining feasibility of operation in Earth?™s gravity (so as to be functional)

title: Laboratory Environment
statement: The demonstrator shall be able to work under laboratory conditions in a temperature range between 10 and 30 deg

title: Gravity conditions
statement: The demonstrator shall be able to work under 1g

title: Demonstrator Power supply
statement: The demonstrator shall be able to be powered from standard power plugs

title: Demonstrator Safety
statement: Demonstrator shall be inherently safe during operation, considering the implementation in a laboratory environment with trained operators
comment: Safety should consider mechanical and electrical potential issue. Safety can be addressed by system design (limited speeds, compliance) and/or through implementation of safety features (Emergency stops, interlocks or sensors barriers)

title: SVC and TGT test bench
statement: A test bench shall be designed and integrated to represent the SVC satellite to the CLT spacecraft, considering the gap existing between both the platform during docking condition

title: Test bench mechanical structure
statement: The structure of the test bench shall be stable and able to carry the own mass and the loads introduced by the SMs and WM

title: Test bench SI interfaces
statement: The SVC and CTL test benches shall provide the required number of SI to cover the MOSAR scenario demonstrations

title: SM connection
statement: The WM shall be able to connect to the SI of the SM or the spacecraft mockup, independently through one of its own SI

title: SM manipulation
statement: The WM shall be able to move and assemble the functional modules in a 3-dimensional way

title: Joint position control
statement: The WM shall provide local joint position control at minimum 500 Hz

title: Cartesian position control
statement: The WM shall provide local Cartesian position control of the free end-effector at minimum 500 Hz
comment: To support manipulation of the SM along pre-defined trajectories and initial SI alignment

title: Impedance control
statement: The WM shall provide impedance control at minimum 500 Hz
comment: To support SI alignment or connection process

title: Fault detection
statement: The WM shall be able to detect malfunction of its operations

title: Power-on/off
statement: The WM shall be able to be powered on/off, keeping its current position
comment: To reduce consumption when the WM is not in use. The power switch could be managed at the SI level

title: WM start and initialization
statement: The WM shall be able to start and initialize automatically after power-on, reaching a state ready for communication and operations

title: WM perception
statement: The WM could have the ability to perceive the location of SMs in three dimensions to an error of 1cm using attached stereo vision sensors.
comment: Not required with the current approach of WM SM approach and manipulation (based on known geometry and SM localization). Would require additional sensors

title: WM payload capability
statement: The WM shall be able to manipulate a payload of 7kg all around his workspace
comment: The target is to not implement external gravity compensation on the SM, TBC depending on the updated weight estimations during PDR

title: WM reachability
statement: The WM kinematic structure shall be compatible in size and joint configuration to support all MOSAR scenarios demonstrations
comment: Kinematic configuration and reachability analyzed during PDR phase

title: WM data interface rate for TM/TC
statement: The data interface of the WM shall support a data rate of 1Mbps or greater for TM/TC control.
comment: The TM/TC control of the platform should not rely on high data rate links with low latency.

title: WM data interface rate for service data
statement: The data interface of the WM shall support a data rate of 50 Mbps or greater for service data.
comment: E.g. to support data transfer from a connected SM The services provided by the Spacecraft Module share the same data interface as TM/TC and will have a higher bandwidth requirement. At 50 Mbps, a 4Mpixel image will take several seconds to transfer across the data network.

title: WM power interface rate
statement: The power interface of the WM shall support 0.5kW [TBC] of power transfer
comment: For the operation of the WM and one connected SM (APM). Value TBC for PDR

title: WM TM/TC
statement: The WM shall transmit telemetry and receive high-level tele-command with the SVC OBC, independently through the data interface of one of the connected SI

title: WM data transfer
statement: The WM shall be able to transmit TM/TC and data from the SVC OBC with the SM connected at its SI

title: WM power
statement: The WM shall get power from the spacecraft/modules through the power interface of the connected SI

title: WM power transfer
statement: The WM shall be able to transmit power to the SM connected at its SI

title: WM interface switch
statement: The WM shall be able to switch power and data interface between the two SI extremities

title: WM local CAN network
statement: The WM shall provide a local CAN network to interface and control the end-effectors SI
comment: CAN network technology is currently selected based on OG5 outputs

title: WM local control network
statement: The WM shall be able to parse information from/to its data interface through the two SI extremities and translate it in its own local bus for Real-Timer monitor and control of its joins.

title: WM mechanical interface to SI
statement: The WM shall provide a mechanical interface connection at each extremity to attach a SI

title: SI as WM end-effectors
statement: The WM shall be equipped with a SI at each of its extremities

title: Embedded controller
statement: The WM shall have an embedded local controller to convert high-level control commands from the SVC OBC to low-level control of the joints

title: Torque/force sensors
statement: The WM shall be equipped with Force/Torque sensors to support the implementation of the impedance control
comment: End-tip of joint torque TBC

title: Compatibility to environmental tests conditions
statement: The design of the WM shall be such that it is able to withstand the test environmental conditions

title: Compatibility to space design
statement: The design of the WM shall be such that the later product is able to withstand the harsh conditions in space

title: WM weight
statement: The weight of the WM shall minimized with a targeted weight of 14kg [TBC], including the SI.
comment: Based on the assumption of a 1 to half payload capability of 7kg

title: SM functions
statement: The SMs shall provide all required support functions to any embarked unit and guarantee the required operative profile during the lifetime

title: SM components
statement: Each SM shall be able to host all the components needed to fulfill its functions

title: SM data routing configuration
statement: The baseline functionality of a Spacecraft Module shall include the ability to externally configure the SM?™s data routing function between the Standard Interfaces and services provided by SM

title: SM data transmission
statement: The baseline functionality of a Spacecraft Module shall include the ability to provide external TM/TC control and service data of the Spacecraft Module via the SM data interface once the routing function has been configured

title: SM rower routing configuration
statement: The baseline functionality of a Spacecraft Module shall include the ability to externally configure the SM?™s power routing function between the Standard Interfaces
comment: This can be envisaged by an internal power distribution unit in the SM or at the SI level

title: SM redundancy
statement: The assembled modules shall be able to switch to redundant data and power paths

title: SM power-on/off
statement: The SM shall be able to be powered on/off or put in stand-by mode, keeping its capability to transmit data and power to other SM
comment: To reduce consumption when the SM is not in use.

title: SM start and initialization
statement: The SM shall be able to start and initialize automatically after power-on, reaching a state ready for communication and operations

title: Identification information
statement: The SM shall be able to provide identification information including unique identifier number and list of capabilities
comment: To support automatic detection and plug and play operations

title: Fault detection
statement: The SM shall be able to detect malfunction of its operations

title: SM data interface rate for TM/TC
statement: The data interface of the Spacecraft Module shall support a data rate of 1Mbps or greater for TM/TC control.
comment: The TM/TC control of the platform should not rely on high data rate links with low latency.

title: SM data interface rate for service data
statement: The data interface of the Spacecraft Module shall support a data rate of 50 Mbps or greater for service data.
comment: The services provided by the Spacecraft Module share the same data interface as TM/TC and will have a higher bandwidth requirement. At 50 Mbps, a 4Mpixel image will take several seconds to transfer across the data network.

title: SM power interface rate
statement: The power interface of the SM shall support [1-2kW] [TBC] of power transfer
comment: The power APM should be able to deliver the required power for the operations of the other SM, WM and SI. Value TBC for PDR

title: SM power
statement: The SM shall get power from the power interface of one of the connected SI

title: SM R-ICU power Up
statement: The Spacecraft Module?™s R-ICU shall be powered up whenever external power is supplied to any of its Standard Interfaces.
comment: Enables plug and play of Spacecraft Modules.

title: SM R-ICU to SI TM/TC
statement: The R-ICU shall provide TM/TC control of the Standard Interfaces using CANbus
comment: The R-ICU is the CAN bus master and the Standard Interfaces are all slaves to the R- ICU. CAN network technology is currently selected based on OG5 outputs

title: SM mechanical interface to SI
statement: The SM shall provide a mechanical interface connection to attach a SI

title: SM structure
statement: The SM structure shall be composed by the following units: ??6 lateral panels ??12 beams ??4 corners ??Connection items (to connect all the units of the SMs with the structural units of the SMs)
comment: For improved cross-compatibility of launchers and internal systems, SMs should target to the form factor for a cubic 27U CubeSat (RD1).

title: Number of SI
statement: All SM shall have a sufficient number of SI in order to manipulate them with the WM and to couple them with each other and to the SVC or CLT
comment: A maximum number of 3 SI are currently considered as optimization between demonstration application and demonstration constraints (weight, costs)

title: SM mechanical loading
statement: The structure of the modules shall be able to carry its own mass under the gravity force and the loads introduced by the ?œwalking??robot-system during the manipulation of the SMs.

title: SM mechanical loading data
statement: The forces applied by the WM and the motion dynamics shall be provided for the design of the SMs in the worst case.

title: SM physical layout
statement: The SMs physical layout shall allow the accommodation of all the equipment, by guaranteeing the proper mechanically assembly, the thermo-mechanical behavior, the SM mechanical/electrical integration and testing, as required by the test requirements

title: SM accommodation
statement: The accommodation of the units shall take into account the following criteria: ??Need of assembly and disassembly ??Easy access to the electrical connectors, fixation points, grounding studs ??Alignment requirements ??Mass distribution ??Envelope ??Harness routing ??FOV constraints (in the case of the integration of optical sensors)

title: SM accommodation flexibility
statement: The SMs structure shall be flexible in order to allow the accommodation of different kind of internal equipment

title: SM face assignation
statement: Only the assigned faces of the SM shall host the standard interfaces. While, only one customized face for each SM shall host all the other units needed to fulfill the SM functions.

title: Thermal conditions
statement: The SMs shall be design in order to guarantee the required thermal conditions to all the units mounted inside the SMs

title: Compatibility to environmental tests conditions
statement: The design of the SM shall be such that it is able to withstand the test environmental conditions

title: Compatibility to space design
statement: The design of the SM shall be such that the later product is able to withstand the harsh conditions in space

title: SM Weight
statement: The weight of the SM shall be minimized with a target mass of 7kg [TBC]
comment: For improved cross-compatibility of launchers and internal systems, SMs should target to the form factor for a cubic 27U CubeSat (RD1).

title: SM size
statement: The SM shall be cubical in shape in size 300 to 400 mm (TBD) per side
comment: For improved cross-compatibility of launchers and internal systems, SMs should target to the form factor for a cubic 27U CubeSat (RD1).

title: SM hand manipulation
statement: The SM shall be able to be safely manipulated by hand

title: Demonstrator SM Configurations
statement: A set of 7 SMs shall be developed, with the following functions: ??4 ASMs: ??Data Management Subsystem module (DMS): this ASM hosts the main Onboard Computer of the target spacecraft. ??Power Subsystem (PWS): is managing the electrical power on the TGT spacecraft. ??Battery ORU module (BAT): is an SM that comprises a set of Lithium- ion batteries and the electronic to manage them. ??Thermal Subsystem module (THS): is responsible for the thermal management of the TGT SMs ??2 APMs Optical Sensor Payload module (OSP): is an SM that exposes an optical lens on one of its faces. ??1 back-up SM
comment: Selection of ASM and APM are illustrative to the possible missions scenario, final selection and specifications of each developed module at PDR

title: Mechanical, Data and Electrical Interface
statement: The standard interface shall provide ??a mechanical interface to mechanically couple two system components ??an electrical interface to transfer electrical energy (power) between two system components ??a data interface to allow exchange of data between two system components
comment: MOSAR system components include Spacecraft Modules, Spacecraft Bus and Walking Manipulator

title: Thermal Interface
statement: The standard interface shall provide a thermal interface to allow active transfer of thermal flow between two Spacecraft Modules
comment: In MOSAR, active thermal transfer is only considered between SM (not with the Spacecraft Bus or Walking Manipulator)

title: Passive Coupling
statement: The standard interface shall allow the mechanical, power, data and thermal coupling with another interface that cannot provide actuation
comment: Passive configurations of the SI is currently envisaged in the scenarios for costs reductions (could also have an interest for future exploitation)

title: Passive Decoupling
statement: The standard interface shall allow the mechanical, power, data and thermal de-coupling with another interface that cannot provide actuation

title: Electrical Interface Protection
statement: The electrical interface shall have an overcurrent and overvoltage protection

title: Electrical Interface Switch
statement: The electrical interface shall incorporate a bidirectional power switch to control current flow at the interface.
comment: Required to support (re)-routing of electrical power. Could also be managed by a central power distribution unit in the SM

title: Electrical Interface Telemetry
statement: The electrical interface shall provide voltage and current telemetry at the power bus system level, in both power transfer direction
comment: Required to monitor (re)-routing of electrical power.

title: Data Interface Support
statement: The data interface shall support at least one technology with capabilities of dynamic data bus re-configuration and routing
comment: Current selected technology in MOSAR is SpaceWire, based on OG4 outputs

title: SI Telemetry
statement: The SI shall measure and store the following local SI parameters: ??Temperature (Power electronics if local, structure) ??Alignment / proximity status ??Locking status ??SI orientation (in relation with design symmetry) ??Data/Power interface status ??Thermal interface status ??Motor position (incremental or absolute) / Mechanism position (absolute) ??Motor current ??Controller supply voltage
covers: OG1-5 Review RD1 Operational Concept RD3
comment: Needed to monitor the function of the SI and support autonomous operation in MOSAR

title: Mechanical Loads
statement: The mechanical interface shall withstand, in connected mode, all mechanical loads induced by the demonstration operations: ??Axial Force: 250 / 160 N ??Radial Force: 250 / 160 N ??Bending Moment: 204 / 84 Nm ??Torsion: TBD Nm As function of the gravity compensation of the SM (TBC).
comment: Best current estimations Required load transfer will depend on the configuration of the demonstrator setup and the possible application of gravity mitigation technics. Due to the complexity of the operations and motions, we currently target to not implement gravity compensation (left number). We could however still envisage compensation of the SM (right number)

title: Positioning Tolerance
statement: The mechanical interface shall maximize positioning tolerance for guidance and mating

title: Power Transfer Rating
statement: The electrical interface shall be capable of supporting [1-2kW] (TBC) of power transfer, as required by the MOSAR demonstration The power interface of the SM shall support [1-2kW] [TBC] of power transfer
comment: Value TBC for PDR

title: Data Interface Rating
statement: The data interface shall allow a data rate of minimum 50Mbit/s
comment: To support the recording and processing of large amounts of data between modules and with the spacecraft, value TBC during PDR phase

title: Thermal Interface Rating
statement: The thermal interface shall allow a thermal flow rating of: TBD W

title: Mechanical Interface to Components
statement: The standard interface shall provide a mechanical connection to the modules, spacecraft bus or robotic base/end-effector manipulator, compatible with the mechanical loads transferred through the interface.

title: Harnessing to Components
statement: The standard interface shall provide internal harnessing to connect power, data and control buses from the module, spacecraft or robotic base/end-effector manipulator

title: Interface to Module Thermal System
statement: The thermal interface shall enable thermal connection to the thermal module sub- system

title: Power Distribution Unit
statement: The SI shall be interfaced with a Power Distribution Unit (PDU) to provide low-level voltage power rails to supply the internal components of the SI (controller, sensors and motor drives)
comment: The PDU could be local to the SI or shared at module level

title: Standard Interface TM/TC
statement: The SI shall be able to send/receive local TM/TC to/from the module or spacecraft OBC TM: See FuncR_D109 list TC: ??Coupling / de-coupling (TBC for intermediate states) ??Electrical power transfer on/off ??Low-level control (TBC)
comment: Based on OG5 developments, CAN is the current selected technology for SI TM/TC

title: Redundant Data/Power/Control Interface
statement: The SI shall feature redundant data, power and control interface
comment: In case of failure, the SI shall be able to switch to a redundant bus

title: Androgynous Design
statement: The standard interface shall have an androgynous design, including mechanical, data, power and thermal interface

title: Design Symmetry
statement: The standard interface shall present a 90deg. rotational symmetry, including mechanical, data, power and thermal interface
comment: The standard interface shall allow module connections without restriction on relative module orientation

title: Diagonal Engagement
statement: The standard interface shall allow diagonal engagement up to 55 deg
covers: OG1-5 Review RD1 Operational Concept RD3
comment: To enable multiple simultaneous approach and connection (e.g. corner example)

title: Form-Fit Guidance
statement: The standard interface shall provide guidance form-fit features
covers: OG1-5 Review RD1 Operational Concept RD3
comment: To support the alignment process between two interfaces, specifically when multiple connections are considered, without requiring external guidance system

title: SI Costs
statement: The design of the SI shall take into account optimization of the manufacturing and integration costs
comment: Cost should be a design driver considering the large quantity of interfaces in the proposed operational concept.

title: Standard Interface Mass
statement: The standard interface shall be optimized regarding the mass

title: Standard Interface Volume
statement: The standard interface shall be optimized regarding size and volume
comment: To reduce constraints on the module design and integration

title: Standard Interface ShutDown
statement: The standard interface (or a part of it) shall be able to be switched off/on (behave as a passive plug), while ensuring data and power transfer.
comment: In regards to the total mission time, the operation time of the standard interface is very small. For energy optimization, it could be interesting to be able to switch off the component (and be able to revive it later).

title: Standard Interface Power Consumption
statement: The power consumption of the standard interface shall be minimized
comment: Values TBC during PDR phase

title: Coupling Time
statement: The coupling time between two standard interfaces shall be minimized
comment: MOSAR demonstration will require a lot of successive mating/demating operations

title: SI Safe Manipulation
statement: The SI shall be safe to be manipulated during integration within SM, WM or Spacecraft Buses. If there exist potential risks, they shall be well documented

title: SI Design Configurations
statement: The standard interface shall be declined in different configurations that are: ??Active ??Passive (not active behavior but can be couple and transmit data and power) ??Mechanical (not active and can only be coupled) ??Thermal (including thermal interface connectors, either active or passive)
covers: OGs costs and physical characteristics constraints
comment: This is mainly to support costs and volume/weight reduction in the ground demonstrators. This could also be applicable in future mission depending on specific mission characteristics.

title: Design and Simulation Tool Purpose
statement: The design and simulation software shall be able to simulate the system with all related robotic elements and tasks (e.g. reconfiguration) as well as create a robotic compatible servicing plan for the satellite platform

title: Design Software
statement: The software shall support engineers developing new components and satellites and shall give system integrators the chance to test the entire satellite including all relevant aspects of on-orbit assembly and servicing operation.

title: System Simulation
statement: The software shall allow users to simulation and test high-modular building block space system architectures with regard to the requirements and constraints of robotics, structure and the entire system

title: Task Planning and Simulation
statement: The software shall be used to plan and to test the servicing task of the robot system

title: Simulation Topics
statement: The software shall allow to test and simulate the demonstration scenario regarding mechanical and thermal loads as well as distribution of resources.

title: Simulation of Reconfiguration
statement: The software shall allow the addition of functional modules to the spacecraft, perform reconfiguration process, and simulate the servicing task considering dedicated robotic specifications.

title: Environmental Conditions Simulation
statement: The simulation software shall be able to simulate the environmental conditions in LEO
comment: The effects of orbital disturbances and their respective relevance shall be verified based on dedicated simulation output signals.

title: Manipulator Dynamics Simulation
statement: The simulation software shall be able to represent manipulator dynamics like motor dynamics and joint flexibilities, if relevant in the demonstrator scenario.

title: Simulation Real-Time Performance
statement: The simulation software shall be able to compute the reconfiguration scenarios in real time as far as possible.
comment: The real-time performance is verified during reference simulation runs (TBD).

title: Number of SM in Simulation
statement: The simulation software shall be able to process as many replaceable modules models as required according to the demonstration scenarios.
comment: The ability to handle a sufficient number of modules is verified during reference simulation runs (TBD).

title: Simulator Input Interfaces
statement: The simulation software of the FES shall be able to receive joint control inputs from external joint controllers and planners..

title: Simulator Output Interfaces
statement: The simulation software of the FES shall be able to feed back sensor information from sensor models and simulation states to external controllers or a control console

title: Simulator Communication Interface
statement: The simulation software shall be able to communicate with external entities via TCP/IP or UDP

title: Generation of plan for onboard execution
statement: The ground instance of the ERGO Agent used to generate and validate the reconfiguration plan shall generate a static plan that can be transferred to and executed by the onboard ERGO Agent.

title: Simulator Computing Platform
statement: The FES shall run on an individual single-purpose PC

title: Scenario Simulation Models
statement: For each scenario to be demonstrated, an individual simulation model shall be provided
comment: In order to minimize re-configuration activities

title: Extension of TASTE for reconfigurable systems
statement: The TASTE framework shall be extended to support modelling and code generation for software systems that can switch between different configurations known at design time.

title: TASTE-DDS bridge
statement: A middleware bridge generator that enables the communication between TASTE and DDS in runtime should be developed in order to assess the capabilities of the software and modelling environment needed to support the reconfiguration of an onboard system with configurations not known at design time.

title: DDS over SpaceWire
statement: An existing open DDS implementation should be adapted to run over SpaceWire links so that it can be deployed in the MOSAR demonstrator.
comment: Feasibility needs to be assessed

title: Large data transfer over SpaceWire
statement: The software should provide a common mechanism to transfer large data messages (1KiB to 1MiB) over SpaceWire links, in order to transfer images from the camera sensor to the OBC and the ground system.
comment: Feasibility needs to be assessed

title: ERGO robotic arm driver for WM
statement: A robotic arm driver component shall be developed to execute the robot plan actions on the WM and return the observations needed by the Agent to manage the execution of the plan.

title: ERGO Agent for plan execution
statement: An instance of the ERGO Agent shall be deployed on the OBC to command and monitor the execution of the robotic reconfiguration plan generated on ground.

title: PUS services
statement: The monitoring and control from the ground system of the onboard system status and the execution of the robotic reconfiguration plan shall be done using the ESROCOS PUS services library, extended with mission-specific services.

title: Robotics data types
statement: The data types used for the interface between the ERGO Agent and the Functional Layer shall be modelled in ASN.1. If a suitable data type is available from ESROCOS, it should be reused rather than defining a new data type.

title: Plan execution monitoring
statement: A graphical tool shall allow the operator to command and monitor the execution of the robotic reconfiguration plan, both simulated and onboard.
covers: Operational Concept RD3 Demonstrator preliminary Concept

title: TASTE modelling
statement: The TASTE framework shall be used to model the software components running on the OBC. These components include: - Functions related to robot autonomy (ERGO Agent and functional layer) - Sample OBSW for the management of the reconfigurable system (monitoring and control of the SM)

title: Development platform
statement: The development platform for the OBSW shall be Ubuntu Linux 18.04 LTS (64 bit) on x86. The ESROCOS framework, and in particular TASTE, shall be adapted to run on this platform.

title: Validation purpose
statement: The MOSAR demonstrator shall allow to verify and validate the following functionalities relevant for future modular spacecraft missions: ??Creation of a re-configuration execution plan (FuncR_S105) ??Simulation of the execution plan (FuncR_S106) ??Manipulation and repositioning of SM (FuncR_S101) ??Control and re-location of the WM (FuncR_S104, FuncR_S107) ??Update/upgrade of satellite functionalities (FuncR_S102) ??Data and power transfer between SM ??Heat management between SM (FuncR_S115) ??Failure detection and handling (FuncR_S111) ??Resources re-allocation, data and power routing (FuncR_S110)

title: Validation sequence
statement: The validation shall include the following sequence: 1. Calibrate/verify the simulation tool 2. Simulate the reconfiguration process and generate a valid robot execution plan 3. Execute the plan on the demonstrator setup

title: SM modules selection
statement: The SM implemented in the MOSAR demonstrator should be representative of relevant modules for future modular spacecraft missions.

title: Orbital Test Facility
statement: The demonstrator shall be integrated in an orbital simulation facility to validate the MOSAR scenarios
covers: Guidelines AD1 OG9-R13 Guidelines AD1 OG9-R14
comment: The orbital dynamics is not relevant in OG9 ??e.g. docking is not part of the scenarios. The provided facility (in SPACEAPPS??lab) could however produce illumination conditions that are relevant w.r.t. orbital applications (if relevant)

title: Test facility dimensions
statement: The test facility shall ensure a volume of 5 m (L)x 3.5 m (W)x 3 m (H) in order to allow the integration of the test bench and all required components for the regular performance of the demonstration
comment: Values TBC by PDR

title: Test facility displays
statement: The test facility shall provide displays to support the design and monitoring of the execution plan

title: Test facility power
statement: The test facility shall provide the required power for the performance of the demonstration
comment: It can include barrier protections, flashing light during operations,

title: Test facility safety features
statement: The test facility shall provide safety features to guarantee the safe operation of the demonstrator
comment: It can include barrier protections, flashing light during operations,
